content.question: The graph provided shows five different short-run average total cost (<math alttext="S R A T C" overflow="scroll"><mtext>SRATC</mtext></math>) curves of a firm and its long-run average total cost (<math alttext="L R A T C" overflow="scroll"><mtext>LRATC</mtext></math>) curve. Which of the following is true if the firm is operating on its <math alttext="S R A T C sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>SRATC</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> curve and producing quantity <math alttext="Q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: The firm is producing at the minimum efficient scale.
The firm must decrease its output to achieve the minimum efficient scale.
The firm must increase its output to achieve the minimum efficient scale.
The firm is producing at its productively efficient quantity of output.
The firm is experiencing diseconomies of scale.

content.answer: The firm must increase its output to achieve the minimum efficient scale.
